1.text: “My spirit is consumed. My days are extinct, And the grave is ready for me.

2.text: Surely there are mockers with me. My eye dwells on their provocation.

3.text: “Now give a pledge, be collateral for me with yourself. Who is there who will strike hands with me?

4.text: For you have hidden their heart from understanding, Therefore you shall not exalt them.

5.text: He who denounces his friends for a prey, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.text: “But he has made me a byword of the people. They spit in my face.

7.text: My eye also is dim by reason of sorrow. All my members are as a shadow.

8.text: Upright men shall be astonished at this. The innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.

9.text: Yet shall the righteous hold on his way. He who has clean hands shall grow stronger and stronger.

10.text: But as for you all, come on now again; I shall not find a wise man among you.

11.text: My days are past, my plans are broken off, as are the thoughts of my heart.

12.text: They change the night into day, saying ‘The light is near’ in the presence of darkness.

13.text: If I look for Sheol as my house, if I have spread my couch in the darkness,

14.text: If I have said to corruption, ‘You are my father;’ to the worm, ‘My mother,’ and ‘my sister;’

15.text: where then is my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?

16.text: Shall it go down with me to the gates of Sheol, or descend together into the dust?”
